snippet: Six months after the Islamic State seized Iraq’s second-largest city, it has exerted tight control over schools and other aspects of society while doing little to provide services.
abstract: Islamic State has imposed strict new order in Mosul, Iraq's second-largest city, while doing little to provide services; residents say there is no electricity, and spotty maintenance has made tap water undrinkable; many complain that group is too focused on social control.
lead_paragraph: Six months after the Islamic State seized Iraq’s second-largest city, it has exerted tight control over schools and other aspects of society while doing little to provide services.

headline.main: Islamic State Imposes Strict New Order in Mosul, and Deprivation Is a Result
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Imposes Strict New Order in Mosul, and Deprivation Is a Result

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
